newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia noon rubber mixed despite China inquiries.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia noon rubber mixed despite China inquiries.

text.p: The Malaysian rubber market was mixed at noon session despite some inquiries from China on SMR grades of rubber, dealers said.

"There were some inquiries from China for prompt SMR 20 rubber. We are offering them (the Chinese buyers) at 252 cents," a dealer at a trading firm said. "We are still negotiating and business will be known later."

Otherwise trading was slow on lack of other Asian inquiries. "We don't expect much activity from Europe later today as most Europeans have already met their requirements for the summer vacation," the dealer added.
Local dealers are seen covering for sheet and SMR grades, traders said, adding that consumers are also looking to buy forwards right until December positions.
However, producers are unwilling to sell in anticpation of higher prices in the later part of the year when the wet season could led to a supply shortage.
Dealers offered SMR CV at 322 cents, SMR L at 302, SMR 5 at 264, SMR 10 and latex at 219 cents.
At midday, July RSS Ones buyer eased a cent to 275 cents ($1.09) a kg and July SMR 20 buyer was unchanged at 253.50.
